main.name: Welcome Home
main.description: This is an initiative to help anyone in need of a home to find a place where they can belong and seek comfort on those cold, rainy nights.
main.bio: I'm a software developer that enjoys to continuously search for creative ways of using software to make the world a better place, in this case - a place where anyone in need can search for a shelter.
main.workbio: Primarily, I work as a .NET Software Consultant on a project for the Norwegian Government focusing on embassy and governmental platforms in addition to their internal services.
main.aboutplatform: What does it do? It uses the Norway Open Data and searches within a list of GEOJsons of public shelters to find the nearest public home you can go to, based on your current location.
main.aboutopendata: This cool initiative is made possible by Norway's official government open data catalogue data.norge.no, which offers a wide variety of datasets, concepts, APIs and information models. The content comes from both private and public companies in Norway.
main.contactmessage: Have a project for me? Contact me by email. (the contact form is not yet configured)

education.description: Completed my final year abroad at the University of Oslo, where I wrote my thesis on the topic of microservice-based architectures compared to monolithic ones and their comparative analysis.
Completed studies focusing on Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry and Biology in the German language.

work.title: Software Consultant for Norwegian Government
work.description: Backend .NET developer for governmental platforms such as 'government.no' and 'norway.no', in addition to other internal services and platforms for the government.
